title: Toxicity in every game
body:
We won an ARAM match in which i went 22/13 and 1v4 for the win, i get raged at not only for getting that 1v4 win (both teams raging at me), then proceed to get told at the end of the game that im trash and should kill myself, yet no one else in the game did well

Where is the logic, how do these people get away with this

(i have reported all the offenders, if you want names let me know and i'll give them over happily)

replies.body:
Riots solution is to "Mute Everyone"

I laugh every time an admin says that lolz!

Next they will tell you there is a punishment system. Guess what? Takes 10 sec to create a new account!!!!

RIOT = A BLOODY JOKE!

Muting people may not be the most appreciated solution, but it works for me. First hint of toxicity and they get muted.
If you aren't happy with muting, then reporting will help relieve the stress after the game.

At the end of the day, never take those people's words to heart. They need to feel better about their gaming skill, because they struggle in the real world. Most of them are either stressed or have aggressive personalities.

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}
Riot don't care...just give them your money...play and stfu

> [{quoted}](name=Noodlecake,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=dBpIfXOV,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2016-03-31T15:21:52.672+0000)
>
> Riot don't care...just give them your money...play and stfu

*cough* toxic *cough*, this is what im talking about thank you for prooving my point

RIOT TAKE THIS PLAYER AWAY

*sirens in the background*

Sometimes we get a bit of tall poppy syndrome here on oce. If you did well and people feel the need to abuse you it just means they're jealous. Haters are always going to hate and until they get punished don't let them get to you.

I agree! 

It's like this in life too - I think these people are just jealous. Perhaps they were struggling with a champion fight and you happened to take the kill (not saying you KS'd, but just proved to be better in that scenario)? 

Either way it's good you reported them. I would always do so when it comes down to threats and abuse like that. Otherwise, I tend to avoid getting caught in the banter, they are either jealous or just frustrated by your game play in some way. At least you were getting raged at for doing WELL! 

If not, you can't always have a good game. Someone has to loose.

> [{quoted}](name=Cyrup,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=dBpIfXOV,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2016-03-29T23:33:26.140+0000)

 Perhaps they were struggling with a champion fight and you happened to take the kill (not saying you KS'd, but just proved to be better in that scenario)? 

Can't ks in ARAM, but it was 1v4 my whole team died and sion, yas, malph, cho came at me, so i pressed R (nocturne OP lol) and as a tank with titanic killed them (VERY SLOWLY) XD

There's a point where the toxicity just has to be muted, I think.
It's easier that way.

I used to refuse to mute people in case they had some really juicy / cringey dialogue for me, but I don't like engaging in negative banter unless it's between teams.
(I'm not against trash talking if it's all within the game and not abusive against any persons playing, but I don't beleive it should ever be directed at teammates or the people playing- "get rekt", not "get cancer")

A lot of the time, I find people like to hand out undue hatred if they're being bested. Especially if it's a champ they normally play well on.
The aternative is if you're playing on a champ they believe should be discredited for being the "easy" win or the "skill-less" champ.

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}} 
Congrats on the win despite the situation though.
